Expectation1: Support each other emotionally during tough times
Situation1: One sibling returns home from school visibly upset after a difficult day with friends.
Situation2: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Story: I heard the front door slam and saw my little sister drop her backpack, her eyes red and puffy. She didn’t say anything, just trudged to her room. I knew something was wrong—she always tried to hide it, but I could tell. I wanted to go after her, to sit on her bed and listen, like I always did when things got rough at school. But my phone buzzed. It was my girlfriend, reminding me that she was waiting at the café. This was our last weekend together before she left for months, and we’d promised to make every moment count. She’d been looking forward to this all week, and so had I. I stood in the hallway, torn. My sister needed me now, but so did my girlfriend. I could feel the weight of both their expectations pressing down on me, my heart pulled in two directions. I hesitated, keys in one hand, my sister’s closed door in front of me, and my phone lighting up with another message.
